page.title: 09HISTORY: TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: The church of Tedstone Delamere is set in the deep narrow valley of the Punch Bowl which looks out upon pastoral scenes of valley and hills. The small church has a single centre aisle and is crowned by a shingle bell turret with a pyramid cap. One enters via an oil lit porch. The chancel is new but the nave is ancient with stout{Norman walls which may even be partly Saxon.It has two{Norman}windows and an arch in the wall which may be part of a Saxon doorway. There is a Norman font with a primitive looking round bowl, and a delicately traced Medieval oak screen. In the churchyard stand two worn coffin lids. The shaft of the Medieval cross has a later head, but the original with the carvings of the Madonna and child is now in the wall by the lychgate.
